edu.ucla.sspace.mains

Class GenericMain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucla.sspace.mains.GenericMain
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BasisMaker, BeagleMain, CoalsMain, DependencyGenericMain, ESAMain, GenericWordsiMain, GrefenstetteMain, GwsMain, HALMain, IsaMain, LpcsMain, LpsaMain, LSAMain, PLSAMain, PurandareMain, RandomIndexingMain, ReflectiveRandomIndexingMain, VsmMain

    public abstract class GenericMain
extends Object
    A base class for running SemanticSpace algorithms. All derived main classes must implement the abstract functions. Derived classes have the option of adding more command line options, which can then be handled independently by the derived class to build the SemanticSpace correctly, or produce the Properties object required for processing the space. All mains which inherit from this class will automatically have the ability to process the documents in parallel, and from a variety of file sources. The provided command line arguments are as follows:
    • Document sources (must provide one)
      • -d, --docFile=FILE[,FILE...] a file containing a list of file names, each of which is treated as a separate document.
      • -f, --fileList=FILE[,FILE...] a file where each line is treated as a separate document. This is the preferred option when working with large corpora due to reduced I/O demands for multiple files.
    • Program Options
      • -o, --outputFormat=text|binary} Specifies the output formatting to use when generating the semantic space (.sspace) file. See SemanticSpaceIO for format details.
      • -t, --threads=INT how many threads to use when processing the documents. The default is one per core.
      • -w, --overwrite=BOOL specifies whether to overwrite the existing output files. The default is true. If set to false, a unique integer is inserted into the file name.
      • -v, --verbose specifies whether to print runtime information to standard out
    Author:
    David Jurgens

    • Method Detail

      • getSpace

        protected abstract SemanticSpace getSpace()
        Returns the SemanticSpace that will be used for processing. This method is guaranteed to be called after the command line arguments have been parsed, so the contents of argOptions are valid.

      • getAlgorithmSpecifics

        protected String getAlgorithmSpecifics()
        Returns a string describing algorithm-specific options and behaviods. This string will be printed before the default option details

      • usage

        protected void usage()
        Prints out information on how to run the program to stdout using the option descriptions for compound words, tokenization, .sspace formats and help.

      • getSpaceFormat

        protected SemanticSpaceIO.SSpaceFormat getSpaceFormat()
        Returns the format in which the finished SemanticSpace should be saved. Subclasses should override this function if they want to specify a specific format that is most suited for their space, when one is not manually specified by the user.
        Returns:
        the format in which the semantic space will be saved

      • addExtraOptions

        protected void addExtraOptions(ArgOptions options)
        Adds options to the provided ArgOptions instance, which will be used to parse the command line. This method allows subclasses the ability to add extra command line options.
        Parameters:
        options - the ArgOptions object which more main specific options can be added to.
        See Also:
        handleExtraOptions()

      • handleExtraOptions

        protected void handleExtraOptions()
        Once the command line has been parsed, allows the subclasses to perform additional steps based on class-specific options. This method will be called before getSpace.
        See Also:
        addExtraOptions(ArgOptions)

      • postProcessing

        protected void postProcessing()
        Allows subclasses to interact with the SemanticSpace after the space has finished processing all of the text.

      • setupProperties

        protected Properties setupProperties()
        Returns the Properties object that will be used when calling SemanticSpace.processSpace(Properties). Subclasses should override this method if they need to specify additional properties for the space. This method will be called once before getSpace().
        Returns:
        the Properties used for processing the semantic space.

      • setupOptions

        protected ArgOptions setupOptions()
        Adds the default options for running semantic space algorithms from the command line. Subclasses should override this method and return a different instance if the default options need to be different.

      • getDocumentIterator

        protected Iterator<Document> getDocumentIterator()
                                          throws IOException
        Returns the iterator for all of the documents specified on the command line or throws an Error if no documents are specified. If subclasses should override either addFileIterators(java.util.Collection<java.util.Iterator<edu.ucla.sspace.text.Document>>, java.lang.String[]) or addDocIterators(java.util.Collection<java.util.Iterator<edu.ucla.sspace.text.Document>>, java.lang.String[]) if they use different file format. Alternatively, oen can implement a CorpusReader and use the -R option.
        Throws:
        Error - if no document source is specified
        IOException

      • addCorpusReaderIterators

        protected void addCorpusReaderIterators(Collection<Iterator<Document>> docIters,
                            String[] fileNames)
                                 throws IOException
        Adds a corpus reader for each file listed. The first value in fileNames is expected to be the class type of the corpus reader.
        Throws:
        IOException

        Parameters:

      • saveSSpace

        protected void saveSSpace(SemanticSpace sspace,
              File outputFile)
                   throws IOException
        Serializes the SemanticSpace object to outputFile. This uses outputFormat if set by the commandline. If not, this uses the SemanticSpaceIO.SSpaceFormat returned by getSpaceFormat().
        Throws:
        IOException

      • parseDocumentsSingleThreaded

        protected void parseDocumentsSingleThreaded(SemanticSpace sspace,
                                Iterator<Document> docIter)
                                     throws IOException
        Calls processDocument once for every document in docIter using a single thread to interact with the SemanticSpace instance.
        Parameters:
        sspace - the space to build
        docIter - an iterator over all the documents to process
        Throws:
        IOException

      • parseDocumentsMultiThreaded

                               Iterator<Document> docIter,
                               int numThreads)
                                    throws IOException,
                                           InterruptedException
        Calls processDocument once for every document in docIter using a the specified number thread to call processSpace on the SemanticSpace instance.
        Parameters:
        sspace - the space to build
        docIter - an iterator over all the documents to process
        numThreads - the number of threads to use

        IOException

      • loadValidTermSet

        protected static Set<String> loadValidTermSet(String validTermsFileName)
                                       throws IOException
